content.description: 15 foot slab with about an 80 degree incline. Mostly flat with a few good crimps and underclings. Seated start near the center of the boulder with the top on a deep cut ledge.
content.protection: You will need to bring crash pads. The area below is a small dirt pad with big rocks surrounding all sides.
content.location: Park at the Raven Rock Trails parking lot (First parking lot on the right when you enter). Walk the main trail 1.5 miles and down the stairs to Raven Rock. Go left at the bottom of the stairs until the trail turns to some big rocks you have to walk on. Once you hit these rocks, this slab will be directly to your left against the main wall.

content.description:
**I don't mean to step on anyone's toes, but as far as I know, I'm the FA.***

click here for a video!

vimeo.com/125962603

I found saw this line pretty late after I'd been down to this wall, but as soon as I saw it, I knew it would be sick.

Sit start on a sharp left hand crimp and a slightly better right hand crimp at the base of the overhang. Move up to the jug and reset feet. Left hand up high to a kind of slopey crimp, then out right to a sharp, little sidepull. Fall into a higher left hand edge, then move up and right to the far end of a jug at the top of the 45. Grab the lip to your left and enjoy the scenic topout.
content.protection: It's a pretty tall line with a crap-ass fall zone... some pads would be smart
content.location: Climb up the obvious 45 wall on your immediate left as you enter the cave. Sit start on a sharp left hand crimper and a slightly better right hand. Finish on the deep lip to the left.
